title: Security XDMP-OLDSTAMP  errors on EC2 instances
description:
Experimenting with S3 on EC2 instances.  I have a startup script that creates the S3 bucket and then creates forests on 
S3 with a fastdir on EBS.  Consistently when I install ML and create the forests they are disabled with no indication in the
ErrorLog as to why.  If I detach them from the DB and reattach the state is cleared.

If I dont rpm install MarkLogic I do not see this failure (or it is less prevalent)

The following script recreates the problem

/etc/init.d/MarkLogic stop
rm -rf /var/opt/MarkLogic/*
rpm -e MarkLogic
rpm -i MarkLogic-7.0-20130226.x86_64.rpm
sed -i s/MARKLOGIC_EC2_HOST=1/MARKLOGIC_EC2_HOST=0/ /etc/sysconfig/MarkLogic
/etc/init.d/MarkLogic start
sleep 20
curl 'http://localhost:8001/license-go.xqy?license-key=3689-3E82-7293-8C38-A931-2E93-EE17-09BE-C97E-E373-A32D-59E4-2749-B9C5-5E44-799B-DC17-E437-89B0-D95E-E2FB-9F9C-2000&licensee=MarkLogic%20-%20Denis%20Sheahan&ok'
curl 'http://localhost:8001/agree-go.xqy?accepted-agreement=development'
curl http://localhost:8001/initialize-go.xqy
curl --digest -u admin:admin http://localhost:8001/qa-restart.xqy
sleep 30
curl 'http://localhost:8001/security-install-go.xqy?auto=true&user=admin&password1=admin&password2=admin&realm=public'
curl --digest -u admin:admin 'http://ec2-23-22-147-231.compute-1.amazonaws.com:8001/credentials-admin-go.xqy?/sec:credentials/sec:aws-access-key=AKIAJFEVG7RSZONJC57Q&/sec:credentials/sec:aws-secret-key=Ar13VsmVJkXVNYySc%2FheDES4ac4%2BefrMcfiSqhTX'
curl --digest -u admin:admin http://localhost:8001/qa-restart.xqy
sleep 30
curl --digest -u admin:admin http://localhost:8001/create_database.xqy
curl --digest -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:8001/create_s3_forests_with_fastdir.xqy?datadir=s3://marklogic-marklogic__sdbv17-marklogic__sdbv17_1a-data&fastdir=/var/opt/mldata&fcount=2&host=ec2-23-22-147-231.compute-1.amazonaws.com&node=node1&cluster=marklogic__sdbv17_1a'
curl --digest -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:8001/create_replica_forests.xqy?datadir=/var/opt/mldata&fcount=2&host=ec2-23-22-147-231.compute-1.amazonaws.com&node=node1&cluster=marklogic__sdbv17_1a'
curl --digest -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:8001/attach_forests.xqy?host=ec2-23-22-147-231.compute-1.amazonaws.com&node=node1&cluster=marklogic__sdbv17_1a'
curl --digest -u admin:admin http://localhost:8001/create_role.xqy
curl --digest -u admin:admin http://localhost:8001/create_httpserver.xqy
curl --digest -u admin:admin http://localhost:8001/create_appserver.xqy
curl --digest -u admin:admin http://localhost:8001/set_metering_on.xqy

After this script the cpox database is disabled and the status of both S3 forests is:
 
marklogic__sdbv17_1a-node1-1 - This forest has an error, is disabled, or is catching up with replication. See status page for more information.
marklogic__sdbv17_1a-node1-2 - This forest has an error, is disabled, or is catching up with replication. See status page for more information.

Occasionally it will succeed but generally it fails.
note: I used m1.large instance type to reproduce

changeHistory.comment:
A forest is disabled when the enabled config parameter on the assignment.
The message "This forest has an error, is disabled, or is catching up with replication. See status page for more information." 
is an ambiguous prettified "user-friendly" generic message that the admin gui says that means very little to me.
What does the ErrorLog.txt file say, and what does forest-status for the forest say?
You could just attach a full support dump, as I think that would include the output of ErrorLog.txt and forest-status for the forest.

Error in log is 
2013-02-27 18:54:00.254 Error: UpdateLicenseMeterTask::run: XDMP-OLDSTAMP: Timestamp too old for forest Security
 
Entire log from start of instance below.

forest status returns the following

<forest-status xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/status/forest">
  <forest-id>10055192510009898905</forest-id>
  <forest-name>marklogic__sdbv17_1a-node1-1</forest-name>
  <host-id>10457316365745102834</host-id>
  <state>unmounted</state>
  <error>XDMP-OLDSTAMP: Timestamp too old for forest Security</error>
</forest-status>
<forest-status xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/status/forest">
  <forest-id>7321121006592293908</forest-id>
  <forest-name>marklogic__sdbv17_1a-node1-2</forest-name>
  <host-id>10457316365745102834</host-id>
  <state>unmounted</state>
  <error>XDMP-OLDSTAMP: Timestamp too old for forest Security</error>

I will confirm I always get this

2013-02-27 18:54:00.254 Error: UpdateLicenseMeterTask::run: XDMP-OLDSTAMP: Timestamp too old for forest Security

It looks like an error in the metering code.
Does this happen if you have metering turned off?

There are now two types of Metering.  Usage metering is on by default and I turn on Performance metering at the end of the script (although I believe I have tried with it of).  I will confirm if either of these help

Right now I don't think it's specific to metering or to s3.
I think for some reason with this sequence if events the security database gets updated and merged so quickly compared to the other stuff going on
that the other stuff going on gets XDMP-OLDSTAMP when it does a security lookup.
